page.title: 15Pigeon Palace
page.content: At{Quenington Court a,}commandery for the Knights Hospitallers,there is a most impressive dovecote. The dovecote is about six hundred years old.It is a circular stone building seven and a half metres in diameter.The walls are a metre thick. It is approximately sixteen metres high .The entrance door is no more than one and a half metres high. Upon entering the dovecote one immediately notices the nest sites for the doves. There are more than five hundred nest sites.They are arranged arround the dovecote in sixteen layers,each layer containing thirty or more nest sites. Each nest site stretches almost half a metre into the wall and would have contained a number of birds. Dovecotes were important to the {continued on page16
